channel.title: Abnormal Mapping
channel.description: Abnormal Mapping is the video game nightmare of Matthew Marko and Jackson Tyler, two people who play too many games and don’t spend nearly enough time talking about them. This is a monthly podcast, which includes a game club component and tries to be both critical and entertaining, but mostly just manages to find itself in the digital weeds again and again. It’s a wonderland of navel gazing. It is the walking simulator of video game podcasts.
channel.itunes:author: Matthew Marko, Jackson Tyler
channel.itunes:summary: Abnormal Mapping is the video game nightmare of Matthew Marko and Jackson Tyler, two people who play too many games and don’t spend nearly enough time talking about them. This is a monthly podcast, with a game club each month and a long journey down the nebulous paths of being into and even maybe making games. It’s a wonderland of navel gazing. It is the walking simulator of video game podcasts.
channel.itunes:subtitle: The walking simulator of video game podcasts.

item.title: Coolsoge 2: Captain Worf, Steak Afficianado
item.description:
Matt braves audio failure as Jackson drags him kicking and screaming through another Coolsoge adventure. After many many weeks between them, the Mappers have a pile of games they've finished and the dimmest of memories with which to recall them, but they do their best to talk about various driving and skating games, the terror of suplexing scorpions, and some Donkey Kong follow-up beef. Vows are made to cast the Coolsoge more often and they pour one out for the machete man gang, but eventually it all collapses into Star Trek talk, because it always does when Matt and Jackson are talking longer than 15 minutes. Featuring special guest Worf, son of Mogh, it's the second Coolsoge onslaught! 

Stuff Talked About!

Trashpect Ratio, Jackson and Matt's new movie podcast
The Abnormal Mappers on The Badland Girls
Matt's Blackwell Let's Plays
Jackson's article about Uncharted
Jackson's other article about the Burnout series

Games Covered (some spoilers, fair warning!)

Resident Evil 4
The Blackwell Series
Uncharted 3
Deadly Creatures
Tony Hawk's Pro Skater (all of them)
Thrasher: Skate and Destroy
Papo y Yo
Burnout 3 & Revenge
Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze
Fire Emblem: Awakening
Persona 4 Golden (and Persona 5)
Mass Effect
Star Trek Online
Outland
Rogue Legacy
Nintendo 3DS Guide: Louvre
bit Generations series

Music Used

Show Your Moves by Kevin MacLeod
Skate or Die 2 Main Theme by Rob Hubbard
Star Trek: The Next Generation Theme by Jerry Goldsmith by way of the NES Sound Chip
Busted Bayou by David Wise
item.itunes:subtitle: Skating, Scorpions, and more Donkey Kong

item.title: Abnormal Mapping 9: The Quantic Dreamcast
item.description:
This month is a special month, as we're joined by special guest Destiny Sturdivant of the Badland Girls for not only our first guest third chair but also our longest episode ever! Deciding to double our pleasure, double our fun, we take a dive into the duo of Quantic Dream games for the Playstation 3—Heavy Rain and Beyond: Two Souls. We go deep on both games, both mechanically and in their many storytelling successes and failures. It's a doozy, but I can sincerely say this is our best episode yet, so it's worth the movie-length runtime! Please enjoy, and we'll be back next month for more regular inanity in this show notes space!

Destiny Sturdivant is a podcaster and comedian, you can find her on twitter or on BadlandGirls.com!

Games Discussed This Month

Heavy Rain
Beyond: Two Souls

Next Month's Game Club

Planescape: Torment

Music in This Episode

Blown Away by Kevin McLeod
Painful Memories by Normand Corbeil
Jodie's Theme by Lorne Balfe & Hans Zimmer
Lost Cause by Ellen Page 
New Angels of Promise (Omikron The Nomad Soul ver.) by David Bowie
item.itunes:subtitle: Heavy Rain and Beyond: Two Souls

item.title: Abnormal Mapping 8: CSI: Citadel Security Investigation
item.description:
The mappers take a journey to a world where anthropomorphic animals live alongside humans and a journey begins to acquire a number of magical orbs. No, it's not Dragon Ball, it's Beyond Good & Evil! In between all the stealth and shutterbugging, Matt decides to take a single joke as far beyond its breaking point as he can, while Jackson tries his best to detangle the good and evil of game beginnings and how they relate to the games as a whole. Deep down, they mostly just look towards the future, and reflect on past mistakes. It's a learning opportunity for us all in this very special* episode.

*episode not that special, really

Games and Topics This Month

Beyond Good & Evil
Video game openings both good and evil
ZZT by Anna Anthropy, which is great but not really good or ... you get the point.\
http://plzdiversifyyourpanel.tumblr.com/ Note from Matt: at the time of recording this was a very newly minted idea, and many of the things we discussed have since been addressed directly by the people running the site. It's even more endorsable than it was, and definitely worth your eyeballs on it.

Next Month's Game Club Games

Heavy Rain
Beyond: Two Souls

Music in this Episode

Blown Away by Kevin McLeod
Propaganda by Christophe Héral
Mass Effect Main Theme by Jack Wall
Shine by Magnus Birgersson
Nuclear by Mike Oldfield
item.itunes:subtitle: Beyond Good & Evil, game beginnings

item.title: Coolsoge Cast 1 - Donkey Kong is not an idiot
item.description:
What was supposed to be a simple 'let's get our plans for the month nailed down' chat between Matt and Jackson turned out to be nothing but lies and deceit as Jackson fired up the recorders and started what would become the first Coolsoge Cast! Instead of the meticulous planning and structure of real Abnormal Mapping podcast, what you'll instead get here is some free flowing talk about whatever we've been playing when we aren't playing game club games. This is an every-once-in-a-while cast, but you'll get such magical tangents as the lineage of the Kong clan and the mysterious secrets of Dark Eco, along with some real talk about Transistor's many faults. We go all over! You might say this one is ... off the map.

Games Covered (with spoilers, fair warning!)

Transistor
Donkey Kong Country Returns 3D
Mario Kart 8
Wolfenstein (2009)
Jak 1, 2, AND 3
Ratchet & Clank
F1 2013

Music Used

Show Your Moves by Kevin MacLeod
DK Rap by Grant Kirkhope
item.itunes:subtitle: What was supposed to be a simple 'let's get our plans for the month nailed down' chat between Matt and Jackson turned out to be nothing but lies and deceit as Jackson fired up the recorders and started what would become the first Coolsoge Cast!...

item.title: Abnormal Mapping 7: British Numerical System
item.description:
Ace pilots Matty "Cupcake" Marko and Jackson "Ginger" Tyler fly through the enormous Library of the Giants, where the giant tombs of Video Game Lore are stacked to the heavens. Whether they have been shrunk or the pillars of writing have grown is beyond the pay grade of these two intrepid wingmen, but as they juke around zines and loop through forests of critical theory they arrive at their destination: Fortress Games Podcasts. Their payloads are ready, a full tactical strike of thermonuclear cast, meant to eradicate the enemy and wrest victory from certain defeat. They squeeze the triggers, and await orders to fire.  

Please check out abnormalmapping.com for relevant links, contact info, and music that appears in this episode.
item.itunes:subtitle: Our Reading List and Ace Combat 6: Fires of Liberation

item.title: Gameography 1 - Christine Love
item.description: In this, the first very special Abnormal Mapping episode, we play through the entire gameography of game maker Christine Love. Please join us for this adventure into social manipulation, visual interfaces, history as storytelling, and cute girls. For more information, including the full list of games, please visit abnormalmapping.com.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this, the first very special Abnormal Mapping episode, we play through the entire gameography of game maker Christine Love. Please join us for this adventure into social manipulation, visual interfaces, history as storytelling, and cute girls. For...

item.title: An Introduction to Gameography
item.description:
The Mappers are dropping this short cast on the world to talk about their first special project, a deep dive at the entire game history of one game designer. This intro is just to talk a bit about why they're doing this project, and to announce the first person to get the Gameography treatment: visual novel magical girl Christine Love! 

For a longer description of the project and a full list of the games we'll be playing, visit abnormalmapping.com!
item.itunes:subtitle: What is gameography? And our first project!

item.title: Abnormal Mapping 6 - Peripheral Cyclops
item.description:
The Mappers dig into the ancient jungle tombs filled with the un-biodegradable legacy of dozens of one-off novelty music games and the shells of grimy controllers—trying to wrap their heads around wrapping their hands around these relics of a bygone era. Emerging from the tombs, they find a box-busting Bandicoot before them, challenging them to one final task in this three month sojourn through some of the most significant games of the 90s. What ever happened to the Bandicoot of tomorrow? All this and more is revealed within.

Topics Discussed: video game controllers and controls, Crash Bandicoot

Next Month's Game: the collected works of Christine Love!
item.itunes:subtitle: Controllers, controls, and Crash Bandicoot!

item.title: Abnormal Mapping 5 - Dwayne Johnson's Wig
item.description:
The mappers find themselves in a glitch world, where the insomnia madness encroaches and the very internet begins to disintegrate. Our intrepid heroes carry on, reversing the course of last month’s progress to embrace the numbers and meters of ye olden games, and ride this regression wave directly into the past to confront the satanic baby of Johns Carmack and Romero within its pixelated heavy metal womb. Will a carton of juice and a shotgun be enough to survive this trek?

Games Discussed: Bravely Default, Doom

Game Club Game in March: Crash Bandicoot
item.itunes:subtitle: Bravely Default, Doom, and a Return to Formalism

item.title: Abnormal Mapping Fo(u)r Podcast
item.description: A mountain of games, atop which sits the greatest of all video games: The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past. But are the mappers capable of scaling the video game mountain and in what frame of mind will they encounter their goal? In this episode both Matt and Jackson have existential crises when they consider the deepest of all questions: WHAT IS GAME?
item.itunes:subtitle: The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past and an Indie Game Apocalypse

item.title: Abnormal Mapping 3 - Chasing the Fenix
item.description:
The Mappers dive behind cover again and again as they brave the assault of fake Halo in order to achieve the goals of fake Metal Gear, but alas, fake Gears of War prevents them from truly enjoying any of the madness. Back at the base, the Mappers get wistful over the benefit of putting one's cultural background into games with the Rabbinical detective of The Shivah. Also, The Hobbit comes up, for whatever reason. This is the end of 2013, and we go out with a very in-character whimper. 

Next month’s game: 
The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past

Things mentioned in the podcast:
A Buddhist’s Guide to Asura’s Wrath
a thematic review of The Binding of Isaac
the infamous philfishglass.jpg
that hot Christmas blockbuster, The Hobbit
item.itunes:subtitle: The Shivah and Vanquish

item.title: Abnormal Mapping 2 - Swapachu
item.description:
Bolstered by their first successful adventure, Mapper Matt decides to lead the team into the murky waters of his own nostalgia. There lurk the monsters of the pocket, which threaten to reveal the bald designs of the 90s to Mapper Jackson in a way that brings sadness to them both. How better to escape these doldrums than to go into space? Never mind the horror of recursion, sometimes you just need to float in nothingness to feel truly alive.

Games discussed: The Swapper, Pokemon X/Y
item.itunes:subtitle: The Swapper and Pokemon X/Y

item.title: Abnormal Mapping Episode 1
item.description:
This is the stiff but auspicious debut of Abnormal Mapping! Join the American Mapper Matt and the British Mapper Jackson as they try to navigate the murky shared waters of video games. It's a strange place, but they're ready to rise to the occasion! ... right? 

Games Discussed: Gunpoint, DmC: Devil May Cry, Bayonetta
item.itunes:subtitle: The Debut! Intro, Gunpoint, and DmC: Devil May Cry
